articles.author: STEPHEN GROVES and MARY CLARE JALONICK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — After months of struggling to find agreement on just about anything in a divided Congress, lawmakers are returning to Capitol Hill to try to avert a government shutdown, even as House Republicans consider whether to press forward with an impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden.
articles.title: Congress returns to try to prevent a government shutdown while the GOP weighs an impeachment inquiry

articles.author: LISA MASCARO and MARY CLARE JALONICK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Senate Republican Leader Mitch McConnell’s health episodes show “no evidence” of being a stroke or seizure disorder, the Capitol physician said in a letter on Tuesday, offering little further explanation for the apparent freeze-ups that have drawn concerns about the 81-year-old's situation.
articles.title: Sen. McConnell's health episodes show no evidence of stroke or seizure disorder, Capitol doctor says

articles.author: STEVE PEOPLES
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The end of Labor Day weekend would typically mark the start of a furious sprint to the Iowa caucuses as candidates battle for their party's presidential nomination.
articles.title: A Trump-Biden rematch may be on the horizon in 2024, whether voters like it or not

articles.author: HYUNG-JIN KIM and KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korean leader Kim Jong Un may travel to Russia for a summit with President Vladimir Putin, a U.S.
articles.title: Kim Jong Un and Putin may meet. What do North Korea and Russia need from each other?

articles.author: MICHAEL KUNZELMAN, LINDSAY WHITEHURST and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Former Proud Boys national chairman Enrique Tarrio will be sentenced on Tuesday for a plot to attack the U.S.
articles.title: Former Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio faces sentencing in the Jan. 6 Capitol attack

articles.author: JAKE BLEIBERG and PAUL J. WEBER
articles.description: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — The impeachment trial of Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton began Tuesday and hurtled Republicans into a reckoning over whether to oust a prominent member of their party after years of alleged corruption or stand with one of former President Donald Trump's biggest defenders.
articles.title: Texas AG Ken Paxton pleads not guilty at impeachment trial then leaves as arguments get underway

articles.author: R.J. RICO
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — Sixty-one people have been indicted in Georgia on racketeering charges following a long-running state investigation into protests against a proposed police and firefighter training facility in the Atlanta area that critics call “Cop City.”
articles.title: 61 indicted in Georgia on racketeering charges connected to 'Stop Cop City' movement

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A new book about Joe Biden portrays the president as someone whose middle-class upbringing helped foster a resentment of intellectual elitism that shaped his political career and sometimes caused strain with his onetime boss, Harvard-educated Barack Obama.
articles.title: New book details Biden-Obama frictions and says Harris sought roles 'away from the spotlight'

articles.author: JAKE COYLE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Hollywood is at a standstill. Actors and screenwriters are months into a dual strike. Film sets are dark. But the movies are still coming — or, at least, most of them.
articles.title: Fall Movie Preview: Hollywood readies for a season with stars on the sidelines

articles.author: RALPH D. RUSSO
articles.description: No. 21 Duke and No. 22 Colorado moved into the Associated Press Top 25 college football poll Tuesday after scoring the biggest upsets of the opening weekend of the season and No.
articles.title: Colorado, Duke surge into the AP Top 25 after huge upsets; Florida State climbs into top five
